alert.note: Alert for San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 11:55AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... San Juan River At Shiprock affecting San Juan County. San Juan River Near Archuleta affecting San Juan County. San Juan River At Farmington affecting San Juan County. .Snowmelt in the San Juan Mountains is driving up flows in the Animas River. These flows are combining with increased flows on the San Juan River from the controlled release of water out of Navajo Dam. Water will be flowing quickly and may overtop the banks in low lying areas. Exercise caution near the banks of the river as they may be unstable. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows are expected in the river with possible overbank flow in low lying areas. * WHERE...San Juan River at Shiprock. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 14.3 feet Thursday morning. - Action stage is 13.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon around 100 PM MDT.
